options.name: Hacker
options.description: Gain +1 Technology and +1 Concentration. You have advantage on checks to access or manipulate electronic systems.

options.name: Code Breaker
options.description: Gain +1 Technology. You can break electronic encryption in half the normal time.

options.name: System Backdoor
options.description: After successfully hacking a system, you can create a hidden access point that allows you to re-enter the system without making a check.

options.name: Data Analysis
options.description: Gain +1 Technology and +1 Science. You can quickly scan and interpret large volumes of data, identifying patterns and key information.

options.name: Action : System Override
options.description: Take control of an electronic device or system for 1 minute. The difficulty depends on the complexity and security of the target system.

options.name: Reaction : Firewall
options.description: When you or an ally is targeted by an electronic attack or detection system, you can attempt to block it with a Technology check.

options.name: Bypass Security
options.description: Gain +1 Technology and the ability to disable security systems without triggering alarms. You have advantage on checks to disable electronic security measures.

options.name: Action : Digital Sabotage
options.description: Target an electronic system and make a Technology check. If successful, the system malfunctions in a way of your choosing for 1d4 minutes.

options.name: Free Action : Quick Hack
options.description: You can attempt to hack simple electronic devices (like door locks or cameras) as a free action once per turn.

options.name: Master Hacker
options.description: Gain +1 Technology and +1 Concentration. You can hack any system given enough time, regardless of its security measures. Additionally, you can remotely access electronic systems from twice the normal range.
